cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi (105 km) NE of Cozumel, Mexico

motion.direction: Stationary (expected to begin drifting north Monday)

cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move slowly north into the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then accelerate NE toward Florida’s Big Bend, cross the Southeast U.S., and move offshore near the GA/SC coasts mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key–Tallahassee area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch only in effect for western Cuba (Pinar del Rio, Isle of Youth)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning in effect Yucatán Peninsula, Mexico, from Tulum to Rio Lagartos (including Cozumel)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf Coast of Florida, then the Southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (heavy rainfall guidance for Southeast mid- to late week)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible but uncertain; depends on exact track and intensity when passing GA coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (11%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds; gusty squalls possible late Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate surge could occur if the center passes just offshore with onshore flow, but confidence is low at this lead time
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 3–5+ inches to coastal Georgia late Wed–Thu, producing localized flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands cannot be ruled out during closest approach
